page.title: 03WEATHER IN SELSEY
page.content: Selsey gets more than the average amount of{sunshine}because it juts out into the sea.The{salt}in the sea helps keep the frost and snow away.The{South {Downs}and the{Isle of Wight}help protect Selsey too.The clouds seem to part and go around the back of the South Downs and the Isle of Wight. About once every 20 years Selsey has a very cold winter.1984-85's winter was very cold and Selsey had a lot of snow. Every day at 0900 Greenwich Mean Time Patrick Moore,the astronomer, reads the temperature and measures the rainfalland records it all in a book.
